alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 2:08PM EST until February 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...MIXED PRECIPITATION EXPECTED LATER TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY... .Low pressure will move south of the region late tonight and on Friday with precipitation overspreading the region. Colder air will filter in from the north bringing the potential for a wintry mix with locations closer to the Canadian border changing to all snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 7 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch, sleet accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch and ice accumulations up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 7 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected as air temperatures fall below freezing early Friday. While significant travel impacts are not expected for the morning commute...falling temperatures in the afternoon with a period of sleet and freezing rain...will likely cause some slick travel for the evening commute. Precipitation may change to snow for a brief period before ending.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
